intro: Ardisia santafeana, commonly known as the Santa Fe beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are bright red berries that contain several seeds. Ardisia santafeana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
